product_name: Outdoor Research Axiom Rain Jacket - Men's
long_description: Innovative, lightweight and extremely breathable, the Outdoor Research Axiom storm-shell jacket is engineered for fast and light alpine climbs and all-day lapping of untracked slopes. The Axiom excels during highly aerobic ascent in rugged conditions; even after the 4th lap of your favorite backcountry stash, your jacket will still be breathing easily. Made with Gore-Tex(R) Active shell fabric, it provides complete waterproof protection while remaining highly breathable; rapid moisture transfer helps keep you dry and warm. The inner backer fabric is integrated directly into the membrane, allowing exceptional breathability and excellent next-to-skin comfort. This incredible breathability negates the need for pit zippers, which further saves weight in this streamlined and durable shell. Helmet-compatible hood shields head from the elements; side and back volume adjustments tailor the fit without impairing vision or limiting mobility. Interior stormflap behind front zipper keeps chilling wind out; chin guard protects sensitive skin. Low-proflile, water-resistant zippers protect from moisture and save on overall weight. Drawcord hem and rip-and-stick cuff closures seal in warmth. 2 hand pockets and a zip chest pocket provide quick stash options; hand pockets are set so they won't interfere with hip belt or climbing harness. Left hand pocket doubles as a stuff sack. Articulated elbows provide a natural fit and superior movement. Outdoor Research Axiom jacket has a trim fit that keeps jacket close while still allowing for athletic and dynamic movement.
